attributes.action: Make more stringent compensation penalties for Banks who poorly supervise their staff, particularly foreign workers, when they break the law, invade privacy, telephone out - of - hours, over - charge and put people under incredible amounts of pressure.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: In keeping with the NHS Plan, which has one target goal (number 5) to reduce suicides, can I remind the British govt. that there is clear evidence, from previous Public Inquiries, that harrassment and financial problems are one of the main contributory factors to breakdown. Just "putting it back" does little to instil confidence in the Exchequer's supervisory powers of the banking industry, or indeed, of the High Street's branch's ability to monitor it's employment and customer service procedures when the damage has already been done. No wonder bank charges need to be so high, given the cost of photocopy ink !
